intro: Manglietia aromatica var. calcarea, commonly known as the calcareous manglietia, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It is characterized by its large, fragrant white flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has thick, waxy leaves that are adapted to thrive in shaded, moist environments. It is a member of the family Ericaceae and is known for its slow growth and ornamental value. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
